intro: Triquetra boetica, commonly known as the Sicilian triquetra, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its distinctive trifoliate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or coastal areas. Due to its ornamental value and historical use in traditional medicine, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
